definition: to be called/to be known as
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: This paper presents a traditional Chinese medical expert consultation system named ZRK82.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍了一个名为ZRK82的中医专家咨询系统。

sentences.english: The official called the 1882 "Law of Bills."
This ship model is a miniature copy of a life-sized Arab dhow called the Sohar.
sentences.chinese: 这是名为“苏哈尔”的阿拉伯帆船模型。

sentences.english: The beetle contains a caustic acid-like juice called cantharidin.
sentences.chinese: 该甲虫体内含有一种腐蚀性的酸性液体，名为斑蝥素。

sentences.english: Lunar olivine was created by great volcanoes called fire fountains, which sprayed superheated lava into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 月之橄榄石产生于名为“火喷泉”的巨型火山。

sentences.english: These costs are charged to an asset account entitled organization costs.
sentences.chinese: 这些成本计入一个名为开办费的资产账户。

sentences.english: The attacker was identified by the state-run Xinhua news agency as Wu Huanming, 48.
sentences.chinese: 中国新华社确认了该袭击者名为吴焕明，四十八岁。

sentences.english: One such surface is known as the pseudosphere.
sentences.chinese: 一个这样的曲面名为伪球面。

sentences.english: The financial system is held together with a very thin filament called confidence.
sentences.chinese: 金融体系只靠一条名为信心的细线所维系。

sentences.english: Underneath their fur, polar bears have an additional 10-cm-layer of fat, called blubber.
sentences.chinese: 在毛皮的下面还有一层十厘米厚的脂肪，名为鲸脂。

sentences.english: The company was previously known as Golden Harvest, but changed its name last year after a merger.
sentences.chinese: 橙天之前名为嘉禾，去年公司并购后改名。

sentences.english: New mechanic called vanishing which uses time counters on permanents.
sentences.chinese: 有个名为消散的机制会在永久物上使用计时指示物。

sentences.english: We see a statue called "Augustus of Prima Porta".
sentences.chinese: 我们看到一座名为“第一门的奥古斯都”的雕像。

sentences.english: With the title Open Happiness, the song is an advertisement by association.
sentences.chinese: 这首名为《畅爽开怀》的歌靠的就是“联想”作广告。

sentences.english: I named the entire activity "blued books".
sentences.chinese: 我为整个活动取名为《蓝色图书》。

sentences.english: Our Father, Jesus, Hallowed be your name.
sentences.chinese: 我们的父，耶稣，愿人都尊你的名为圣。

definition: called/named
not long ago
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
to give a name to/to dub/to christen/to designate/named after/naming
on the one hand
it is said that/reportedly
to name (sth)
according to belief/it is believed that
not long ago/not long before
it is rumored that .../it is reported that ...
it is said/allegedly/according to reports/or so they say
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
of the same name/homonymous/self-titled (album)
to emerge to meet a historic destiny (idiom)/to arise at an opportune time/able to take advantage of an opportunity/to rise to the occasion
grand reputation/renowned/famous
variant of 秤[cheng4]/steelyard
to weigh/to state/to name/name/appellation/to praise
to fit/balanced/suitable
